dcterms:creator: Gail Weiss
Yoav Goldberg
Eran Yahav
dcterms:description: The Dyck-1 language consists of well-balanced sequences of opening and closing parentheses, where at each time step the total number of opening parentheses must be greater than or equal to the total number of closing parentheses.
dcterms:title: Dyck-1 Language

dcterms:creator: Gail Weiss
Yoav Goldberg
Eran Yahav
dcterms:description: The Dyck-2 language is a context-free language that requires a model to possess a stack-like component for recognition, consisting of sequences of two types of parentheses.
dcterms:title: Dyck-2 Language

dcterms:creator: Gail Weiss
Yoav Goldberg
Eran Yahav
dcterms:description: The Shufﬂe-2 language is generated by shuffling two Dyck-1 languages, each defined over disjoint parentheses, to investigate the ability of recurrent networks to perform dynamic counting.
dcterms:title: Shufﬂe-2 Language

dcterms:creator: Gail Weiss
Yoav Goldberg
Eran Yahav
dcterms:description: The Shufﬂe-6 language is generated by shuffling six Dyck-1 languages, each defined over different parenthesis pairs, to explore the emulation of a dynamic-counting 6-counter machine.
dcterms:title: Shufﬂe-6 Language
